passages.text:
Ah, hello again. How are you finding my town so far?
[[It's nice.|like it]]
[[I'm just here to make some money.|Make money]]

links.name: I'm just here to make some money.|Make money
links.link: I'm just here to make some money.|Make money

passages.name: Start

passages.text:
Ah, I'm glad you think so. We don't get many visitors here... And those that do visit often don't stay for long. Life out here isn't easy, so we've remained rather isolated from the rest of the world... But I don't believe there are many here who would complain about that. Do you feel similarly?
[[I like being on my own.|like isolation]]
[[I tend to perfer larger towns.|pefer larger]]

links.name: I like being on my own.|like isolation
links.link: I like being on my own.|like isolation

links.name: I tend to perfer larger towns.|pefer larger
links.link: I tend to perfer larger towns.|pefer larger

passages.name: like it

passages.text:
Yes, yes. But even someone with dollar signs in their eyes can't help but see the natural beauty we have all around us. Surely there must be something you've enjoyed here. How has the fishing been?
[[It's good.|good fishing]]
[[It's slow going.|slow going]]
passages.name: Make money

passages.text:
Ah, that is good to hear! The outside world -- or at least, what little I've seen of it -- can be rather overwhelming at times. Here, things are simple.
[[continue]]
passages.name: like isolation

passages.text:
Oh, I am sorry to hear that. But I'm sure there are other things that drew you to this place... The sea is generous, is it not? That's why we make an effort to return the favor once a year. It gives us everything we have, so it's only fair that we give something back. Even if it's something we don't want to lose.
[[I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye]]

links.name: I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye
links.link: I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye

passages.name: pefer larger

passages.text:
I'm glad to hear it. The sea is generous, isn't it? That's why we make an effort to return the favor once a year. It gives us everything we have, so it's only fair that we give something back. Even if it's something we don't want to lose.
[[I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye]]

links.name: I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye
links.link: I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye

passages.name: good fishing

passages.text:
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that... and a bit shocked, frankly. Keep at it! The sea is normally so generous... It gives us everything we have, so it's only fair that we give something back at least once a year. Even if it's something we don't want to lose.
[[I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye]]

links.name: I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye
links.link: I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye

passages.name: slow going

passages.text: Of course. I will speak with you later.
passages.name: bye

passages.text:
We coexist with the sea, living off of its generosity. Then when it is time, we return the favor, and give something back. It is an important gesture... even if what we give ends up being something we don't want to lose.
[[I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye]]

links.name: I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye
links.link: I'm going to get back to fishing.|bye

passages.name: continue
